content: Currently rustdoc only generates HTML for reading documentation. This requires a Web browser, which is far from ideal for some (often limited) environments. Would alternative targets (such as forms of plaintext, etc.) be considered?
A JSON output is already being worked on - see its RFC and its tracking issue.
Unfortunately it hasn't seen any activity recently

Kestrer said:

Unfortunately it hasn't seen any activity recently

Well, it depends on how you define "recently", there are some open PR like https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93518 and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/93529, those are from start of last month and I think that other PRs have been merged since.
As far as I can tell (I personally use it) the JSON output is starting to be in a good shape and after those two PR I think that the design phase will be over and more stable.
